definition: to promise to keep sth in good repair/guarantee/warranty
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
dried meat/private teacher's remuneration/withered/variant of 修[xiu1]
surname Xiu
to decorate/to embellish/to repair/to build/to write/to cultivate/to study/to take (a class)
guarantee period/warranty period

sentences.english: He buys new and sells when the warranty runs out.
sentences.chinese: 他买新车开，一过保修期就卖。

sentences.english: Your watch will be repaired free if it is still under guarantee.
sentences.chinese: 你的手表在保修期内可享受免费修理。

sentences.english: The warranty covers all power-train components.
sentences.chinese: 保修单包括了电动火车的所有零件。

sentences.english: Guarantee is the main point of service under non-price competition.
sentences.chinese: 非价格竞争下，产品保修是售后服务的主要内容。

sentences.english: The cave at Yangjialing where Mao lived for five years has been well maintained.
sentences.chinese: 杨家岭毛曾经住过5年的窑洞一直得到良好的保修。

sentences.english: Every new television comes with a guarantee.
sentences.chinese: 每台新电视机都有保修单。

sentences.english: Cars known for dependability will guarantee parts for as many as 70,000 miles.
sentences.chinese: 可信赖的品牌汽车可以提供7万英里的保修期限。

sentences.english: This VCD can be returned for repair under warranty.
sentences.chinese: VCD在保修期间可以退回维修。

sentences.english: One year free warranty, life-long service.
sentences.chinese: 一年免费保修，终生服务。

sentences.english: D high-quality after-sales service, product warranty for one year, life-long service.
sentences.chinese: 四售后服务质量高，产品保修一年，终身服务。

sentences.english: Customer must present this warranty card when warranty service is requested during warranty period.
sentences.chinese: 提出进行保修时，消费者必须出示有效保修卡。

sentences.english: Customer must present this warranty card when warranty service is requested during warranty period.
sentences.chinese: 提出进行保修时，消费者必须出示有效保修卡。

sentences.english: Within one year free warranty mm.
sentences.chinese: 一年之内免费保修保换。

sentences.english: Proper use of white space can also add to the attractiveness and legibility of your warranty.
sentences.chinese: 适当使用空白，也可以使保修书美观和易读。

sentences.english: Housing quality book documenting the various parts of warranty period.
sentences.chinese: 质保书详细记载了房屋各个部位的保修期限。

sentences.english: The warranty period begins on the date of vehicle invoice.
sentences.chinese: 通用汽车的保修期自购车发票日期起算。

definition: guarantee period/warranty period
authorized goods/genuine goods/crudely-made goods
to replace a purchase/to exchange a purchase
to guarantee refund or replacement (of faulty or unsatisfactory goods)
to undertake to rectify any deficiencies in the quality of a building, product or service/warranty/guarantee
to return a product for another item
to dismantle a machine/to terminate a telephone service
after-sales service
(of electronic goods) refurbished
joint guarantee (finance, law)
"three-guarantee service": repair, exchange, refund
genuine/intact in original packaging (not locally assembled and packaged)
to replace firmware (on a mobile device)
house call fee/callout fee
hardware-only device/computer without operating system or other software installed/mobile phone or pager without network subscription
component/part/fitting/accessory/replacement part
